questions.text: You are at a health camp screening children in a community for malnutrition. According to the new WHO growth standards, the cut-off value of mid-upper arm circumference to define severe acute malnutrition is _______.
questions.solution:
The cut-off value of mid-upper arm circumference to define severe acute malnutrition is 11.5 cm according to the new WHO growth standards.

Mid-upper arm circumference:

  • Used in children between 6 to 60 months.
  • Measured between the acromion and olecranon process.
  • It is an age-independent parameter (between 6-60 months).

MUAC tape cut-offs:

Color Measurements Indication
Red <11.5 cm Severe acute malnutrition
Yellow 11.5 to 12.5 cm Under-nourished
Green >12.5 cm Normal

questions.text: Under Rajiv gandhi shramik kalyan yojana, an insured person is entitled to claim unemployment allowance of 50% of wage for a maximum period of:
questions.solution:
An insured person is entitled to claim unemployment allowance of 50% of wage for a maximum period of 2 years under rajiv gandhi shramik yojana.

Earlier, an insured person was entitled to claim unemployment allowance for a maximum period of 6 months.

Rajiv gandhi shramik kalyan yojana is an ESI scheme of unemployment allowance that came into effect from 1st April, 2005.

As per this scheme, an insured person who becomes unemployed after being insured three or more years, due to closure of factory/establishment, retrenchment or permanent invalidity are entitled to:

  • Unemployment allowance equal to 50% of wage for a maximum period of upto 2 years.
  • Medical care for self and family from ESI hospitals/dispensaries during the period of unemployment allowance.
  • Vocational training provided for upgrading skills - expenditure on fee/travelling allowance borne by ESIC.

questions.text: Injectable contraceptive DMPA is introduced under which of the following programme?
questions.solution:
Injectable contraceptive DMPA is introduced under Antara programme.

The dosage is 150 mg i.m every 3 months.

Mechanism of action:

  • Inhibition of ovulation
  • Cervical mucus thickening and thereby preventing sperm penetration
  • Endometrial atrophy preventing implantation.

Chhaya, Saheli and Novex are once a week non-steroidal oral pills.

questions.text: A 6-month old baby is presented to the opd with difficulty in sucking and swallowing. On examination, he has tongue fasciculations, frog leg posture and hypotonia. Which of the following can be used for the treatment of this condition?
questions.solution:
The given clinical scenario is suggestive of spinal muscular atrophy. Onasemnogene abeparvovec can be used for the treatment of this condition.

Onasemnogene abeparvovec is a recently approved gene therapy for the treatment of children less than 2 years of age with spinal muscular atrophy.

It is a recombinant adeno-associated viral vector containing complementary DNA encoding the normal human survival motor neuron protein (SMN1). It is for single-dose intravenous infusion only.

questions.text: Which of the following is the semi-synthetic pleuromutilin antibiotic used for the treatment of community-acquired pneumonia in adults?
questions.solution:
Lefamulin is the first-in-class semi-synthetic pleuromutilin antibiotic used for the treatment of community-acquired pneumonia in adults.

It has been recently approved by FDA.

Mechanism of action:

It inhibits bacterial protein synthesis by binding to the A and P sites of the peptidyl transferase center. The binding pocket of the bacterial ribosome closes around the mutilins core for an induced fit that prevents correct positioning of tRNA.

questions.text: The recently approved drug for the treatment of moderate to severe plaque psoriasis in adults who are candidates for systemic therapy or phototherapy is:
questions.solution:
Risankizumab is the recently approved drug for the treatment of moderate to severe plaque psoriasis in adults.

It is an interleukin-23 antagonist.

The recommended dose is 150 mg s.c at week 0, 4 and every 12 weeks thereafter.

questions.text: According to the new ACOG guidelines, the universal rectovaginal culture screening of pregnant women for group B streptococcus is recommended at:
questions.solution:
The universal rectovaginal culture screening for group B streptococcus is recommended at 36 0/7 to 37 6/7 weeks according to the new ACOG guidelines.

Previously, it was recommended at 35 to 37 weeks.

Exceptions:

  • Women with GBS bacteriuria during the current pregnancy
  • Women who had an infant with invasive early-onset GBS infection in a previous pregnancy

questions.text: The mechanism of action of pitolisant is:
questions.solution:
Pitolisant is an H3 receptor inverse agonist.

It has been recently approved by the FDA for the treatment of excessive daytime sleepiness in adults with narcolepsy.

Contraindications:

  • End-stage renal disease
  • Severe hepatic impairment

Other drugs used for the treatment of daytime sleepiness are:

  • Modafinil
  • Solriamfetol
  • Methylphenidate

questions.text:
Which of the following statements are true among the given statements about TRALI?

A. TRALI type I occurs in patients with no concomitant risk factors for ARDS B. TRALI type II occurs in patients who have concomitant risk factors for ARDS C. The presence of mild pre-transfusion ARDS excludes the diagnosis of TRALI
questions.solution:
Statements A and B are true.

New consensus TRALI definition (2019):

  • TRALI type I - patients who have no risk factors for ARDS and meet the following criteria:
  1. Acute onset
  2. Hypoxemia
  3. Clear evidence of bilateral pulmonary edema on imaging
  4. No evidence of left atrial hypertension or, if LAH is present, it is judged to not be the main contributor to the hypoxemia
  5. Onset during or within 6 hour of transfusion
  6. No temporal relationship to an alternative risk factor for ARDS
  • TRALI type II - patients who have risk factors for ARDS or who have existing mild ARDS and is judged to be due to transfusion based on:
  1. Findings as described in categories 1 to 5 of TRALI type I, and
  2. Stable respiratory status in the 12 hour before transfusion

NOTE: The term ‘Possible TRALI’ has been removed in the redefinition of TRALI.

questions.text: The second line of treatment for advanced hepatocellular carcinoma in patients with an AFP level >400 ng/ml and have been previously treated with sorafenib is?
questions.solution:
Ramucirumab is the second line drug for the treatment of advanced hepatocellular carcinoma with an AFP>400 ng/ml.

Ramucirumab is a recombinant monoclonal antibody.

Mechanism of action: It inhibits vascular endothelial growth factor receptor 2 resulting in reduced tumor vascularity and growth.

questions.text: According to the 2019 ASCO guidelines, the optimal duration of adjuvant oxaliplatin chemotherapy for patients with completely resected stage III colon cancer who are at higher risk of recurrence (T4 and/or N2) is:
questions.solution:
The optimal duration of adjuvant oxaliplatin chemotherapy for patients with completely resected stage III colon cancer who are at higher risk of recurrence (T4 and/or N2) is 6 months according to the latest ASCO guidelines.

For patients at a low risk of recurrence (T1, T2 or T3 and/or N1), either 6 or 3 months of adjuvant chemotherapy is offered.

questions.text: Erythropoiesis stimulating agents are recommended for:

choices.text: Chemotherapy associated anemia whose cancer treatment is curative in intent
Low risk myelodysplastic syndromes and a serum erythropoietin level of <500IU/ml

questions.solution:
Erythropoiesis stimulating agents are recommended for low risk myelodysplastic syndromes and a serum erythropoietin level of <500IU/ml.

ESAs are recommended for:

  • Chemotherapy associated anemia whose cancer treatment is not curative in intent and Hb<10g/dL.
  • Low risk myelodysplastic syndromes and a serum erythropoietin level of <500IU/ml

ESAs are NOT recommended for:

  • Most of the patients with non-chemotherapy associated anemia
  • Chemotherapy associated anemia whose cancer treatment is curative in intent because of increased risk of cancer progression or recurrence and thromboembolic events.

questions.text: Match the following:
questions.solution:
Siponimod is a sphingosine 1-phosphate receptor modulator. It has been recently approved by FDA for the treatment of active secondary progressive multiple sclerosis.

Tenapanor is a sodium/hydrogen exchanger 3 inhibitor. It has been recently approved by FDA for the treatment of Irritable bowel syndrome with constipation.

Afamelanotide is a synthetic analogue of alpha-melanocyte stimulating hormone. It increases sunlight tolerance. It has been recently approved by FDA for the treatment of erythropoietic protoporphyria.

questions.text: The objective of LaQshya is:

choices.text: To improve quality of care in labour room and maternity operation theatres
Safe vaccination and universal vaccine coverage

questions.solution:
The objective of LaQshya is to improve quality of care in labour room and maternity operation theatres.

Government of India has launched LaQshya (Labour room Quality improvement Initiative) to improve the quality of care in labour room and maternity operation theatres in public health facilities.

Objectives:

  • To reduce maternal and newborn mortality and morbidity due to preventable causes.
  • To improve quality of care during the delivery and immediate post-partum care, timely referrals and enable an effective two-way follow-up system.
  • To provide the Respectful Maternity Care to all the pregnant women attending the public health facilities.

questions.text: The scheme intended for safeguarding the health of elderly population is:
questions.solution:
The scheme intended for safeguarding the health of elderly population is Vayoshri yojana.

Objective: To provide physical aids and assisted-living devices for senior citizens belonging to BPL category which can restore near normalcy in their bodily functions.

choices.text: Cycloserine, Levofloxacin, Pyrazinamide, Kanamycin for 9 months

questions.solution:
According to the latest guidelines, the recommended treatment regimen for isoniazid mono/poly resistant tuberculosis is Rifampicin, Ethambutol, Pyrazinamide, Levofloxacin for 6 months.

Related Pearl: ATT Regimen for TB Patients

As per the latest recommendations from National Tuberculosis Elimination Programme (NTEP), treatment of TB is now based primarily on drug susceptibility testing. This is irrespective of new cases, previously treated cases or recurrent TB cases. 
All cases of TB are treated with Drug Sensitive TB Regimen, as long as the patient is sensitive to isoniazid and rifampicin. (No classification into category I or II)

Type of TB Case Intensive Phase Continuation Phase
New and previously treated cases (H and R sensitive) 2 months H R Z E 4 months H R E

Classification based on drug resistance. 

The cases are classified as:

  • Mono-resistant (MR): A TB patient, who is resistant to one 1st line anti-TB drug only.
  • Poly-Drug Resistant (PDR): A TB patient, who is resistant to more than one 1st line anti-TB drug, other than Rifampicin and isoniazid. 
  • Rifampicin Resistant (RR): A TB patient, who is resistant to rifampicin with or without resistance to other drugs. Patients, who have rifampicin resistance, should be managed as if they are an MDR TB case.
  • Multi-Drug Resistant (MDR): A TB patient, who is resistant to both isoniazid and rifampicin.
  • Extensively Drug-Resistant (XDR): A MDR TB patient who is additionally resistant to a fluoroquinolone (ofloxacin, levofloxacin, or moxifloxacin) and at least one additional group A drug (as of 2021, these are bedaquiline and linezolid)

questions.text: Which of the following drug is recently approved by FDA to treat adult patients with metastatic urothelial carcinoma that has progressed following prior platinum-based chemotherapy?
questions.solution:
Erdafitinib has been recently approved by the FDA for the treatment of metastatic urothelial carcinoma in adults that has progressed following prior platinum-based chemotherapy.

Erdafitinib is a fibroblast growth factor receptor inhibitor. FGFR inhibition results in decreased FGFR-related signalling and decreased cell viability in cell lines expressing FGFR genetic alterations.

questions.text: The maximum approved daily dose of Istradefylline is:
questions.solution:
The maximum approved daily dose of Istradefylline is 40 mg.

Istradefylline has been recently approved by FDA as an add-on treatment to levodopa in adults with Parkinson’s disease experiencing off episodes.

It is an adenosine A2A receptor antagonist.

questions.text: A 40-year-old man, who has history of contact with a known case of influenza, is having fever, cough, and runny nose since today morning. Rapid antigen test turns out to be positive. The endonuclease inhibitor that can be used for his treatment is ___________.
questions.solution:
The endonuclease inhibitor which can be used for the treatment of acute uncomplicated influenza in adults is baloxavir marboxil.

It is a novel drug that was approved by the FDA in 2018. It is used to treat acute uncomplicated influenza in patients 12 years of age and older who have been symptomatic for less than 48 hours.

It is a selective inhibitor of influenza cap-dependent endonuclease which blocks proliferation by inhibiting mRNA synthesis.

Recent Update: In 2020, the FDA expanded the approved indication for baloxavir marboxil (Xofluza) to include post-exposure prevention of influenza (flu) for patients 12 years of age and older after contact with an individual who has the flu.

questions.text: The topical retinoid that selectively targets retinoic acid receptor gamma is:
questions.solution:
The topical retinoid that selectively targets retinoic acid receptor gamma is Trifarotene.

It has been recently approved by the FDA for the topical treatment of acne vulgaris in patients aged 9 years or older.

Adapalene, Tazarotene and Tretinoin target both RAR-beta and RAR-gamma.
